edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp.batchIngest.data
Class BatchIngestXMLhandler

java.lang.Object
  edu.du.penrose.systems.fedoraApp.batchIngest.data.BatchIngestXMLhandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
BatchIngestXMLhandlerImpl
public abstract class BatchIngestXMLhandler
extends java.lang.Object

Used to sequentially access XML documents contained within a folder for processing by the batch ingest program. The XML document folder is specified by a URL, in the application's properties file. Currently only URLs with a protocol of type 'file:' are allowed.

NOTE: NOT THREAD SAFE! You must create a new object for each batch set.

Author:
chet.rebman
See Also:
FedoraAppConstants.BATCH_INGEST_NEW_METS_FOLDER_PROPERTY, FedoraAppConstants.BATCH_INGEST_FAILED_FOLDER_PROPERTY, FedoraAppConstants.BATCH_INGEST_COMPLETED_FOLDER_PROPERTY, FedoraAppConstants.BATCH_INGEST_WORK_FOLDER_PROPERTY

buildDocumentCheckValid

public abstract org.jdom.Document buildDocumentCheckValid(java.io.File xmlFile,
                                                          boolean validate,
                                                          boolean schemaCheck,

                                                   throws org.jdom.JDOMException
Read and XML file and build a DOM from it checking it against it's schema.

Parameters:
xmlFile - the xml file to check and turn into DOM
validate - perform xml validation
schemaCheck - validate against schema.
schemaLocation - location of xsd file.
Returns:
a valid DOM document.
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException - if unable to build build a valid document.
